children.subject: Oops and I forgot to mention - I found 104 quite challenging, but I think I'm more of an algebra person than an analysis person
which professors would you recommend for each class?

This would probably be good for other people to add to cuz I haven't looked at who is teaching those classes next spring, but I took...

-113 with Sylvie Corteel - she was really good and clear, useful hw & fair exams. I really liked her & would definitely take another class with her

-128A with Ming Gu - he was fine, had fair exams, kinda long/tedious hw sometimes if I'm remembering correctly. Andrew Shi was an AMAZING gsi though which made it a lot better.

-104 with Yu-Wei Fan - he was good & clear but I had a hard time with the class (took it last spring though so  was probably more due to the disruption rather than his teaching I think)
Gu ming is teaching 128A next semester, roughly how many hours per week did you spend on his class?

I can't totally remember. My guess is probably like the usual 3 hours in class, 1 hour discussion, and then a couple hours on hw each week, plus studying for a few quizzes (maybe 2 hours the week of the quiz?) & the midterm(s) (a few hours the week before/week of the midterm) throughout the semester. There was also a programming assignment in matlab that took a bit of time but it was WAY easier for people who knew how to code (for me, probably a bit less or about the same as the amount of time one of the early projects for a class like CS 188 might take)
And I think there might've been like 3 or 4 quizzes, so not too many
Actually wait jk I think there might've been bi-weekly quizzes? Lol I'm not sure. If they were more frequent, I studied a lot less for them (like maybe 1 hour)
overall, would you recommend taking 128A with him lol?
Oh forgot to ask, how was his grading?

Haha umm yeah, I thought it was fine & would do it again. one of my friends who took the class with me wasn't a fan though. about grading - it was the highest grade I've gotten in an upper div math class (I usually get Bs but got an A- in his class without putting more effort than usual into it - might've just been a subject that clicked for me, but I thought his grading was pretty chill for hw/exams/project. you can look at his grading breakdown here - https://math.berkeley.edu/~mgu/MA128A2019F/index.html)

It depends on your strengths & the professors, I think. I'm an applied math major (data science cluster), and I found math 113 to be the most interesting and least work out of 128A/113/104. 128A wasn't too conceptually challenging, but hw sometimes took me a while (lots of computation). I will say that I did better in 128A in terms of grades though

history.content: I would recommend either 113 or 104, but to make final decision I would choose the best professor for you. To find out I would come to the Math Dept + MUSA peer advising night where each math course and professor is discussed that'll happen in a week or so.

Hi,

I am currently a sophomore majoring in CS and applied math. I'm planning to take CS189 and EECS127 next semester and would also like to take a math class with these two. I'm considering one of these three classes: 128A/113/104 but not sure which one to take. Can someone give some advice? Thanks.
history.subject: Class schedule advice
